text: <extra_id_0> USF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - related transcription factor , <extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , stimulates transcription of human immunodeficiency virus-1 .

The transcription factor <extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which binds to a region about 60 bp upstream from the enhancer of the human immunodeficiency virus-1 ( HIV-1 ) , was purified from human B cells .
<extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> had a molecular weight of 39 , 000 .
Binding of <extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to the HIV long terminal repeat ( LTR ) activated transcription from the HIV promoter in vitro .

The <extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - binding site in HIV LTR was similar to the site recognized by <extra_id_0> upstream stimulatory factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> USF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in the adenovirus major late promoter .

DNA - binding properties of <extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> suggested that <extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> might be identical or related to <extra_id_0> USF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Interestingly , treatment of purified <extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by phosphatase greatly reduced its DNA - binding activity , suggesting that phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was essential for DNA binding .

text: The disruption of <extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - binding site induced a 60 % decrease in the level of transcription from the HIV promoter in vivo .
These results suggest that <extra_id_0> HIV-TF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is involved in transcriptional regulation of HIV-1 .
